content:
Hey, there was a discussion to implement a faster string to int method: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/87249
Would it make sense to implement an unchecked version similar to std::str::from_utf8_unchecked?
Optimizing existing code has to pass a lower bar than introducing new API surface. Pointing to some existing code that would benefit would help. Especially the unchecked part.

That makes sense. I thought a bit more about this. If we implement a similar version to what OP suggested, then the validity check will be most likely a separate function in addition to the conversion. This gives the option to provide an unchecked function which simply skips the validation. I think a good first step would be to extend the proposed algorithm to work on all radixes (radices?).
